lines.text: [during a written driving test]
Pssssttt... what does the yellow light mean?
"Slow down."
What... does... the... yellow... light... mean?
"Slow down"!
Whaaaat... dooooeeees... theeeee... yeeeel-looowwww... liiiiight... meeeeaaan?
[in the mountains, Jim hits his head]
Jim, are you alright?
Yeah... who are you?
I'm Alex. We're friends, we work together.
What are we, lumberjacks?
No, we're cabdrivers.
I bet we don't do much business up here!
If you find yourself in a confusing situation, simply laugh knowingly and walk away.
We were wondering if you would join us for a few minutes?
Well, what did you decide?
[On boxing]
The ability to witness two men stand toe to toe in the spirit of sportsmanship and pummel each other into insensibility is what separates us from the animals.
Jim, what are you doing here? Where did this model castle come from?
It's yours, I made it for you. See Elaine, your fairy tale can come true. Look here's your Castle, and your Prince awaits. Elaine, I know I'm not the most glamorous guy in the world but...
You are truly a sweet decent man.
Once there was a time when that was enough.
Hey, Alex - You know the really great thing about television? If something important happens, anywhere in the world, night or day... you can always change the channel.
[while filling out an application]
Mental illness or narcotic addiction?
Now that's a tough choice...
You know, you really need to clean up those bathrooms.
You just came from the kitchen.
Thank God.
What did you win that trophy for?
For making a fool of myself.
Why doesn't anyone tell me about contests like that?
Poor Emily. It's so sad that she mixed drugs and alcohol and spent the night with you... when most people only die.
What're you listening to, Banta?
I can be here if I want to.
No, you can't.
This is America, Louie.
No, it isn't.
It isn't?
No! This is Louieland. You want America, go outside!
Jim, your father is no longer with us.
He never was. He lives in Boston.
No, I mean, he's gone on to his final resting place.
A condo in Palm Beach?
I went to Woodstock.
Oh yeah? You went to Woodstock?
Yep, half a million people gathered together in peace and harmony, grooving to Joni and The Who... hey, you know, if I hadn't gone, there would have only been 499,999 people... lucky for them I went.

[to his now-fat ex-wife, at their daughter's wedding]
Remember, you haven't lost a daughter - you've gained a ton.
[In a flashback to Louie's days as a driver]
All dispatchers are scum.
One thing about being a cabbie is that you don't have to worry about being fired from a good job.
Do you know what the difference is between people like you and people like me, Nardo?
Yeah, two million years of evolution.
[filling out a form]
Eyes...
No, don't put two.
Oh, they mean color, don't they?
Why'd you change your name to Ignatowski?
Try saying it backwards.
Ix-wah-tangy.
That's nowhere near Starchild, is it?
Jim, when are you finally going to have some pride and stand up for yourself?
August!
Ignatowski's got a father? There goes my spore theory!
Hey, Bobby, I hope someone slams a door on your face, you sneeze, and your head explodes.
You must be Louie.
How did you know my name?
I only had three people described to me. One was smart, one was good-looking, and one was you.

I wonder about things, like, if they call an orange an "orange," then why don't we call a banana a "yellow" or an apple a "red"? Blueberries, I understand. But will someone explain gooseberries to me?
You got an attitude problem, you got a personality problem, you got a sensitivity problem, you got an emotional problem, you got a maturity problem, you got a sexual problem...
What do you mean?
That's all you think about!
And that's the problem?
Yeah.
Whew!

[as he hands out invitations]
Bobby, do you spell your name with one "o" or two?
One.
I'll get it right next time, "Booby".
Ignatowski! Where have you been all week?
I don't work weekends.
You been gone nine days!
Yeah...
Jim, weekends are only two days.
Oh, I thought we'd switched to the metric system.
It's so quiet up here you can hear yourself think.
I don't hear anything.
Dress is optional... He means how we dress, not if we dress, right?
No, I don't think so.
Why?

[showing Elaine his invitation]
Yours is the only one that says that.
[about Woodstock]
I wore flowers in my hair and meditated for hours on end. I was finding God all over the place... He kept ditching me.
Jim, when I said you were a flake, I meant you'd done some weird things.
Name one.
You lived in a condemned building for five years.
You're confusing flakiness with style!
You kept a horse named Gary in your bedroom.
Not everyone has a guest room, Alex.
He'll be back... they all come back... the only one who never came back was James Caan... and I'm still waitin'!
Some men climb mountains, others date 'em!
[explaining to his mother in a flashback scene why he wants to move to America]
In America, a man can become another O.J. Simpson!
Who is O.J.Simpson?
The JUICE!

[Elaine is trying to convince a hooker to look nice for her paper marriage to Latka]
Honey, I've been everything from Little Bo Peep to Darth Vader.

[after his paper marriage, his "wife" runs off]
No honeymoon?
No, Latka.
America's a tough town.

[Louie has just admitted his mother needs an operation]
What's wrong with her?
Female problems, she's starting not to look like one.

[as a traveling salesman]
I'm "Fill in your name," but you can call me "Nickname."
[to Bobby after finding out he made a bet over whether or not he would change his ways and hanging him on a hook]

You scum! You lowlife! You creep! I'm gonna make you regret the day you were born! I'm gonna make sure that every night, you get the dirtiest, smelliest cab in the garage, and if there isn't one that's dirty and smelly, then I'm gonna get in and smelly and dirty it up myself! In the wintertime, your cab will have no heater! In the summertime, your windows won't roll down! I'm gonna make you the second most miserable cab driver in all of New York City!
[Walks towards his office, but briefly stops]
The MOST miserable cab driver in all of New York City is whoever lets him down or feeds him!
When I think of me, I smile.
Whenever I hear the word "marriage," I say, "Check, please!"
[Latka pays Louie a coin]
What's this?
It's a kebble.
What's a kebble?
110 kebble make a lithnitch.
What's a lithnich?
270 lithnich make a matta.
What's a matta?
I don't know, what's the matter with you?
I know what love is cuz I watch talk shows. Love is the end of happiness!
I'm not really a cab driver. I'm just waiting for something better to come along. You know, like death.
Get that ugly, flea-ridden, stinking animal out of my garage, and tell him to take his horse with him!
Yeah, I did some drugs, though probably not as many as you think. How many drugs do you think I did?
A lot.
Wow! Right on the nose!
You mean, they didn't tell you they were going to tear down your apartment building?
Well, you put up with a few minor inconveniences when you live in a condemned building.
I'm going to die as I've lived, wearing a green shirt, a catcher's mask, and dancing the can can.
Huskies, I hate 'em.
That dame is older than the Continental Shelf!
Thank you very much!
Mr. Rieger isn't here right now. Would you like to wait in my office?
I'd rather be the only woman on a Greek freighter!
We're arguing because we care too much, and we're breaking up because we don't care enough.
